name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: I promised I would get this project done for our community, and I’m proud to deliver for Orange County. Our beaches are our lifeblood and it’s critical that they are protected and preserved for generations to come.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: In fact, the cities of Newport Beach, Huntington Beach, Seal Beach, and the Orange County Board of Supervisors have requested this funding for decades and have all passed resolutions in support. https://t.co/ESJsHXCJs1

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: When I toured the damage, local officials told me that it’s only a matter of time before the flooding becomes so severe that it poses a threat to human safety. That’s why the project to restore the sand and buffer the tides is supported by local officials across Orange County.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: 📸In 2020, the so-called “King Tide” caused extensive flooding in Newport Beach https://t.co/hJ0rOdLZCq

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: Not only does the problem destroy our landmark beaches, but it also creates a very real threat of flooding that destroys livelihoods and causes severe damage.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: In 1995, after planning the 10th stage of the project, the government abandoned its responsibility to our community, and in 2000, the Army Corps stated that it was no longer budgeting for any future stages in Orange County. This left local communities on the hook to pay the costs

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: The project took place in stages and was 67% funded by the federal government and 33% funded by local communities. The local share of the funding was *always* covered when it was time for a new stage of the project.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: In 1964, the government recognized the problem it had created and initiated the “San Gabriel to Newport Bay Beach Renourishment Project” to make necessary repairs and restore the sand. Today, we call this project the Surfside-Sunset & Newport Beach Replenishment Project.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: The new construction interrupted the natural tidal process which replenishes sand on the shore, creating narrowed beaches up and down the coastline that were now susceptible to extreme erosion.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: In the 1940’s, the Army Corps of Engineers widened Anaheim Bay & constructed breakwaters & jetties to service the new military bases that opened to boost military efforts for the U.S. Pacific Fleet.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel
tweet_text: THREAD 🧵The $15.5 million for the Surfside-Sunset & Newport Beach Replenishment project that the House approved last night is a big deal, here’s why: https://t.co/1B5peeqGb8

Newport Beach residents reported smelling gas all day on Friday. 

Multiple reports of oil sheen in the water were made to officials Friday night and early Saturday morning. 

It took hours to alert the public and local officials as the damage and spread continued to get worse.

name: Rep. Michelle Steel

Pandemic Unemployment Programs have led to widespread fraud across the country, especially in California. This is an unacceptable abuse of taxpayer dollars.
